en: Did your mother make those?

I will do as you say.

ko: 네 말이 다 맞긴 한데, 왠지 마음이 안 놓여.

ko: 이 사진들 너네 삼촌이 찍으신 거지?

en: I owe my success to you.

en: It's just like you say.

You're right in a sense.

en: Without your advice, I would have failed in the attempt.

ko: CD 플레이어 한 시간만 빌려줄 수 있어?

en: Let me give you an example.

ko: 내가 널 도와줄 거라는 기대는 하지 마.

en: May I count on you to get me the job?
ko: 네가 그 일자리 구해줄 거라고 믿어도 돼?

Mail for you will be held until you call for it.

ko: 너한테 도움이 될 만한 책을 읽어봐.

en: Here's to you!
I'd like for you to go.

I am very glad to see you.

It's great to meet you.

I never see you without thinking of my mother.

en: There's an American girl who wants to see you.
ko: 어떤 미국 여자애가 너 보고 싶대.

en: I can't blame you for breaking your promise.

ko: 바쁘신 거 잘 알지만, 프로젝트 진행을 위해 지난번 이메일에 대한 답장이 꼭 필요해요. 잠시만 시간 내서 답장 주실 수 있을까요?

en: You came out of the room.

ko: 너 없는 동안 고양이는 누가 봐줘?

en: If I had known about your illness, I would have visited you in the hospital.
ko: 아픈 줄 알았으면 병문안 갔을 텐데.

ko: 네가 봐서 알겠지만, 얘는 겁쟁이가 아니야.

en: I will never force you to marry him.
ko: 걔랑 결혼하라고 절대 강요 안 할게.

en: For all you say about him, I still like him.
ko: 네가 걔에 대해 뭐라고 해도 난 여전히 걔가 좋아.

en: He will go swimming, whether you go with him or stay at home.
ko: 네가 같이 가든 집에 있든 걔는 수영하러 갈 거야.

en: Will you show me what you bought?
The camera that you bought is better than mine.
ko: 네가 산 카메라가 내 거보다 더 좋아.

en: It's your deal.
I'll look after the children while you go shopping.
ko: 너 쇼핑하는 동안 내가 애들 봐줄게.

en: If you act like a fool, you must be treated as such.
I will take care of you when you are old.
I will badly miss you if you leave Japan.
ko: 네가 일본 떠나면 정말 많이 보고 싶을 거야.

en: I thought you were Japanese.
While you are about it, please make a cup of coffee for me, too.
ko: 커피 타는 김에 내 것도 한 잔만 타 줘.

en: We will miss you terribly if you leave Japan.
ko: 네가 일본 떠나면 우리 다들 정말 서운할 거야.

en: Was he still here when you arrived?
ko: 너 도착했을 때 걔 아직 여기 있었어?

en: Prior to your arrival, he left for London.
ko: 너 오기 전에 걔는 런던으로 떠났어.

en: There is nothing for you to be angry about.
It is natural that you should get angry.
I was disappointed that you didn't call.
I was taking a bath when you called me.
ko: 너 전화했을 때 나 목욕 중이었어.

en: You don't have to be discouraged because you are not a genius.
Read whatever books you think proper.
ko: 네가 보기에 괜찮은 책이면 아무거나 읽어 봐.

en: It is no use your resisting.
I saw you making eyes at Mr Nagashima.
ko: 너 나가시마 씨한테 꼬리 치는 거 다 봤어.

en: Give up smoking if you want to live long.
Please visit as soon as you get into town.
She was astonished that you spoke Chinese so well.
ko: 네가 중국어를 너무 잘해서 걔가 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: I know that boy whom you don't know.
ko: 난 네가 모르는 그 남자애 알아.

en: You must remember to tell him all that you know.
ko: 네가 아는 거 걔한테 전부 말하는 거 잊지 마.

en: Let's look at the path that you've walked so far.
ko: 네가 지금까지 걸어온 길을 한번 돌아보자.

en: It's a better line than when you used to call me from the university.
ko: 대학교에서 전화했을 때보다 통화 감도가 훨씬 좋네.

en: When you dislike others, you are disliked by them in turn.
We are hoping for your quick recovery.
That you have come early is a good thing.
ko: 네가 일찍 온 건 참 잘한 일이야.

en: If you concentrate all your energies on the study of English, you will master the language.
ko: 영어 공부에만 전념하면 금방 마스터할 수 있을 거야.

en: It's all the same to me whether you will go to sea or not.
ko: 네가 바다에 가든 말든 난 상관없어.

en: I'll leave a key with my next-door neighbour in case you get here before I do.
ko: 나보다 먼저 도착할지도 모르니까 옆집에 열쇠 맡겨둘게.

en: I don't think there is any need for you to explain.
ko: 굳이 설명할 필요는 없을 것 같아.

en: Listen to those whom you think to be honest.
ko: 네가 정직하다고 생각하는 사람들 말을 들어봐.

en: Granting that you are honest, that is no proof of your innocence.
ko: 네가 정직하다고 해도, 그게 무죄라는 증거는 아니야.

en: It has dawned upon my mind that you are in the right.
ko: 네 말이 맞다는 걸 이제야 깨달았어.

en: By the time you land at Narita, it will be dark.
ko: 네가 나리타에 도착할 때쯤이면 어두워져 있을 거야.

en: I am pleased at your success.
Is there any place you recommend?
Whom do you respect most in your life?
A woman visited us while you were sleeping.
ko: 너 자는 동안 어떤 여자가 찾아왔었어.

en: Food you eat that you don't like will not be digested well.
ko: 싫어하는 음식을 먹으면 소화가 잘 안 돼.

en: He would have failed in his business but that you helped him.
ko: 네가 도와주지 않았으면 걔는 사업에 실패했을 거야.

en: If it had not been for your help, I should have drowned.
ko: 네 도움이 없었으면 난 물에 빠져 죽었을 거야.

en: Without your help, I would have been unable to do it.
ko: 네 도움 없이는 그거 못 했을 거야.

en: We will keep it for you until you leave.
I want to see you before you go.
ko: 너 가기 전에 얼굴 보고 싶어.

en: Please be careful not to forget to lock the door when you go out.
ko: 나갈 때 문 잠그는 거 잊지 않게 조심해.

en: Your help will save us a lot of work.
ko: 네가 도와주면 일거리가 많이 줄 거야.

en: If you will help me, we will soon finish.
ko: 네가 도와주면 금방 끝낼 수 있어.

en: If you help me, I'll try it again.
What's the name of the man whose car you borrowed?
ko: 네가 차 빌린 그 사람 이름이 뭐야?

en: I think it is dangerous for you to drive a car.
ko: 네가 운전하는 건 좀 위험한 것 같아.

en: It's your turn to answer the question.
The reason for your failure is that you did not try hard enough.
ko: 네가 실패한 이유는 노력이 부족했기 때문이야.

en: I was afraid that you had failed.
It is necessary for you to think about your life.
ko: 네 인생에 대해 진지하게 생각해 볼 필요가 있어.

en: Do it yourself.
She will be glad if you go to see her in person.
ko: 네가 직접 보러 가면 그 애도 좋아할 거야.

en: If you can read the following, we can communicate in Japanese, too.
ko: 이걸 읽을 수 있으면 우리 일본어로도 대화할 수 있겠다.

en: That you will pass the exam is certain.
I am pleased that you have passed the exam.
I'm relying on you to help us.
ko: 우리 좀 도와줄 거라고 믿고 있을게.

en: Everyone will be happy if you help us.
I am glad to help you whenever you need me.
I will accept the work, provided that you help me.
Do you want me to wait until you come for me?
ko: 너 데리러 올 때까지 기다려 줄까?

en: You scratch my back and I'll scratch yours.
ko: 네가 나 도와주면 나도 너 도와줄게.

en: The problem has arisen simply because you didn't follow my instructions.
ko: 네가 내 지시를 안 따라줘서 생긴 문제야.

en: I am very grateful to you for what you've done for my family.
ko: 우리 가족을 위해 해준 일들 정말 고마워.

en: I do not expect you to subscribe to my opinion.
ko: 내 의견에 꼭 동의하라고 하는 건 아니야.

en: Pretend you're me.
I'm glad you like my present.
Either you or I should visit her.
ko: 너나 나 둘 중 한 명은 걔를 찾아가 봐야 해.

en: Either you or I will have to go.
ko: 너나 나 둘 중 한 명은 가야 해.

en: Either you or I will get the first prize.
Either you or I will have to do it.
ko: 너나 나 둘 중 한 명은 그걸 해야 해.

en: Either you or I must attend the meeting.
ko: 너나 나 둘 중 한 명은 회의에 꼭 참석해야 해.

en: I know nothing about him beyond what you told me.
ko: 네가 말해준 거 말고는 걔에 대해 아는 게 없어.

en: It is kind of you to talk about it for me.
ko: 날 위해 그렇게 말해주다니 정말 친절하다.

en: The magazine which you lent me is very interesting.
As you treat me, so will I treat you.
ko: 네가 나한테 하는 만큼 나도 똑같이 해줄게.

en: Tell me what you want me to do.
I'll do whatever you want me to do.
ko: 네가 원하는 건 뭐든지 다 해줄게.

en: It is kind of you to lend me the money.
Either you or I am in the wrong.
We have no objection to your joining us in our club.
ko: 네가 우리 동아리 들어오는 거 우린 찬성이야.

en: Either you or I am right.
I remember you often went to Betty's house to tea when you were a little girl.
ko: 너 어렸을 때 베티네 집에 차 마시러 자주 갔던 거 기억나.

en: When was it that you first met her?
ko: 그 애 처음 만난 게 언제였지?

en: Dinner will be ready by the time you have finished your work.
ko: 네 일 끝날 때쯤이면 저녁 다 될 거야.

en: I'll recommend him as chairman, whether you are in favour of it or not.
ko: 네가 찬성하든 말든 난 그 사람을 의장으로 추천할 거야.

en: Whether you agree or not, I cannot change my mind.
ko: 네가 동의하든 안 하든 내 마음은 안 변해.

en: I'll sweep the floor while you wash the dishes.
ko: 네가 설거지하는 동안 내가 바닥 쓸게.

en: Will you show me what you bought yesterday?
The man you saw in my office yesterday is from Belgium.
ko: 어제 내 사무실에서 본 사람 벨기에에서 왔어.

en: The man that you saw there yesterday was Mr Brown.
ko: 어제 거기서 본 사람은 브라운 씨였어.

en: Let me read the paper when you have finished with it.
ko: 신문 다 보면 나도 좀 보여줘.

en: Here's a comfortable chair you can sit in.
If you are tied up now, I'll call you back later on.
I want to know what you did this summer.
It seems hard for you to see him today.
ko: 너 오늘 그 사람 만나기 힘들 것 같아.

en: What you have just said reminds me of an old saying.
ko: 네가 방금 한 말 들으니까 옛날 속담이 생각나네.

en: If you leave now, I'm sure you'll be caught in a traffic jam.
ko: 지금 출발하면 분명 차 막힐 거야.

en: What is it that you want me to do now?
Who has made you what you are now?
I'll miss you when you're gone.
It makes no difference to me whether you go or not.
It's all the same to me whether you go or stay.
If you don't want to go, you don't need to.
We regret that you have to leave.
If you don't go, I will not go either.
ko: 네가 안 가면 나도 안 갈래.

en: You may invite whoever you like.
ko: 네가 좋아하는 사람은 누구든 초대해도 돼.

en: I do love you.
She said 'I love you' to me.
As you are sorry, I'll forgive you.
He will come if you call him.
ko: 네가 부르면 그 사람 올 거야.

en: I am feeling quite pleased about what you've said.
What you said was in the main right.
You say "ditto", and that's not the same as "I love you".
I know you are clever.
I can't study with you watching me.
ko: 네가 쳐다보고 있으면 공부가 안 돼.

en: It's quite natural that you should think about marriage.
ko: 네가 결혼 생각하는 건 아주 당연한 거야.

en: When you get married and have kids, you'll realize that actions speak louder than words.
ko: 너도 결혼해서 애 낳아보면 말보다 행동이 중요하다는 걸 알게 될 거야.

en: It makes no difference to me whether you are rich or poor.
I really look forward to your visit in the near future.
ko: 조만간 네가 놀러 오는 거 정말 기대하고 있어.

en: If you don't do your duty, people will look down on you.
ko: 네 할 일을 안 하면 사람들이 널 무시할 거야.

en: What you were taught is wrong.
I received great benefit from your teaching.
ko: 네 가르침 덕분에 정말 큰 도움을 받았어.

en: I understand you are going to spend your vacation in New Zealand.
The artist whose paintings you liked is a friend of mine.
ko: 네가 좋아했던 그림을 그린 화가는 내 친구야.

en: There is one important fact of which you are unaware.
ko: 네가 모르는 중요한 사실이 하나 있어.

en: What was your mother doing when you returned home?
ko: 집에 들어왔을 때 어머니는 뭐 하고 계셨어요?

en: By the time you get home, all the cherry blossoms will have fallen.
ko: 집에 도착할 때쯤이면 벚꽃이 다 져 있을 거예요.

en: I'll be in bed by the time you get home.
ko: 집에 올 때쯤이면 저는 자고 있을 거예요.

en: There are a few points where you are mistaken.
Tell me the reason why you were late for school.
This letter arrived while you were out.
We often hear you sing.
Please look through these papers at your leisure.
ko: 시간 날 때 이 서류들 좀 훑어보세요.

en: I found your coat after you left the house.
Whatever you say will set her off crying.
ko: 무슨 말을 해도 그 애는 울음을 터뜨릴 거예요.

en: No matter what you say, I am convinced that I am right.
ko: 누가 뭐래도 제 생각이 맞다고 확신해요.

en: I can't make out what you are trying to say.
ko: 무슨 말을 하려는 건지 잘 모르겠어요.

en: Tell me what you mean.
I know what your game is.
Tell me what you are looking forward to.
No matter what you may say, I will not change my mind.
ko: 뭐라고 하셔도 제 마음은 안 바뀌어요.

en: I will lend you any book that I have, so long as you keep it clean.
ko: 깨끗하게만 본다면 제가 가진 어떤 책이든 빌려줄게요.

en: With your help, our plan would succeed.
It will be hard for you to speak English.
ko: 영어를 말하는 게 쉽지 않을 거예요.

en: English will take you a long time to master.
ko: 영어를 마스터하려면 시간이 꽤 걸릴 거예요.

en: The thing that you are intending to carry does not need to be carried.
ko: 들고 가려는 거 굳이 안 가져가도 돼요.

en: Pick out the shirt that you like best.
ko: 가장 마음에 드는 셔츠로 골라 보세요.

en: Who is your favourite TV star?
I cannot consent to your going alone.
ko: 혼자 가는 건 찬성 못 해요.

en: Let me put it in plain language you can understand.
It is dangerous for you to travel to a foreign country by yourself.
It will be late autumn when you get to London.
I want to split up, but I know I couldn't even if I tried.
ko: 헤어지고 싶지만 노력해도 안 될 거라는 걸 알아요.

en: I've been looking forward to hearing from you for weeks.
ko: 몇 주 동안 연락 오기만을 기다렸어요.

en: I have got a letter from you.
I found your letter in the mailbox.
I can't seem to find your last e-mail, I wonder if you can resend it to me.
ko: 보내주신 마지막 이메일을 못 찾겠는데, 다시 보내주실 수 있나요?

en: I can't believe I misplaced the party information and registration you sent to me.
ko: 보내주신 파티 정보랑 등록 서류를 어디 뒀는지 모르겠네요. 믿기지가 않아요.

en: We are looking forward to hearing from you soon.
I have been hoping to hear from you.
We look forward to receiving your prompt reply.
I wonder if you received my e-mail on January 10, since I have not heard anything from you yet.
ko: 아직 소식이 없으셔서 그러는데, 1월 10일에 보낸 제 이메일 받으셨나요?

en: I will come on Wednesday evening unless I hear from you to the contrary.
I would like to borrow fifty dollars from you.
Is it the case that you have done it?
I think it a pity that you do not study harder.
ko: 공부를 좀 더 열심히 하지 않아서 아쉬워요.

en: If you had left earlier, you would have caught the train.
ko: 좀 더 일찍 나갔으면 기차를 탔을 텐데요.

en: What would you do if you had, say, ten thousand dollars?
ko: 만약 만 달러가 생긴다면 뭐 할 거예요?

en: I know you must be buried in your mountain of mails, but I wonder if I can hear from you regarding the mail I sent you last week?
ko: 메일이 산더미처럼 쌓여 있으시겠지만, 지난주에 보낸 메일 확인 좀 부탁드려도 될까요?

en: Let me see the pictures you took in Paris.
It is a pity that you cannot come to the party.
For all you say, I still believe in the truth of the theory.
ko: 누가 뭐래도 전 여전히 그 이론이 맞다고 믿어요.

en: I can not believe you, whatever reasons you may give.
ko: 어떤 이유를 대셔도 믿을 수 없어요.

en: Whichever route you take, you will get there in time.
ko: 어느 길로 가든 제시간에 도착할 거예요.

en: I miss you so much.
I envy you so much.
No matter where you go, you will be welcomed.
I see why you don't want to go there.
ko: 네가 왜 거기 가기 싫어하는지 알 것 같아.

en: When you don't know what to do, ask the host.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 모를 때는 주인한테 물어봐.

en: No matter who you are or where you are from, one thing is certain.
ko: 네가 누구든 어디 출신이든, 한 가지는 확실해.

en: You should think of their religions.
Did you talk for a long time?
You are supposed to introduce yourselves in turn.
You were in the second year of middle school last year, right?
You need not be afraid of making mistakes.
Did you have a good time at the party?
I don't mind your smoking.
I don't agree with you smoking.
ko: 네가 담배 피우는 거 난 반대야.

en: I'm surprised to see you smoking. You didn't used to.
ko: 담배 피우는 거 보고 놀랐어. 전에는 안 그랬잖아.

en: Do you love each other very much?
I have spoken to you of earthy things.
I'm afraid your request for a pay raise was turned down again.
ko: 안타깝지만 연봉 인상 요청이 또 거절됐어.

en: You should do all you can to help your neighbours.
ko: 이웃을 돕기 위해 할 수 있는 건 다 해야 해.

en: Without your help this plan would be impossible.
ko: 네 도움 없이는 이 계획은 불가능해.

en: I will try to live up to your expectations.
When is your school festival?
I'd like to join your group.
Which of you will try first?
You will save your father a lot of worry if you simply write him a letter.
ko: 그냥 편지 한 통만 써도 아빠 걱정을 많이 덜어드릴 수 있을 거야.

en: You yourselves can testify to what I said.
ko: 내가 한 말은 너희가 직접 증언해줄 수 있잖아.

en: I'm sorry that you should think that way.
I cannot abide hearing you cry so bitterly.
ko: 네가 그렇게 서럽게 우는 소리는 도저히 못 듣겠어.

en: I wasn't aware that you were so ill.
It is strange that you should know that.
I hope you'll think better of it.
ko: 네가 다시 한번 잘 생각해봤으면 좋겠어.

en: Whether you like it or not doesn't matter.
The time will come when you will regret it.
I hope that you will like it.
There is no necessity for you to do that.
It will cost you $100 to fly to the island.
ko: 그 섬까지 비행기 타고 가려면 100달러 들어.

en: I think it natural that you should take the matter into consideration.
ko: 네가 그 문제를 고려해보는 건 당연하다고 생각해.

en: I think it dangerous for you to cross the river.
ko: 네가 강을 건너는 건 위험한 것 같아.

en: Please tell me what you saw then.
It is not necessary for you to quit the job.
I'll wait until you finish the work.
How long has it been since you gave up teaching at that school?

en: The beard does not make the philosopher.

en: Only in theory, the project is possible.

en: He persisted in his opinion.

ko: 안타깝게도 걔 시험 보다가 부정행위로 걸렸대.

en: You may as well give up.

If you keep trying, you will make progress.
ko: 계속 노력하다 보면 실력이 늘 거야.

Akira can play tennis well.

en: What does Akina have on?
Do you mind if I turn off the light?
As a light goes out, so a man dies.
ko: 불이 꺼지듯이 사람도 그렇게 죽는 거야.

en: Frankly, I don't like him.
Would you please refrain from smoking when babies are here?
ko: 아기들이 있을 때는 담배 좀 삼가 줄래?

en: If there is already an account, there is a system by which you are able to send and receive email.
ko: 계정이 이미 있으면 이메일을 주고받을 수 있는 시스템이 있어.

en: Tyger, Tyger, burning bright.
I dared to support his opinion.
You need not take the trouble to go.
At the risk of sticking my neck out, I think that if we do that, we're making a big, big mistake.
ko: 욕먹을 각오하고 말하자면, 그렇게 하면 우리 진짜 큰 실수 하는 거라고 봐.

en: You don't have to cancel your vacation.

I will not presume to give an opinion.
I make a special point of avoiding that shop.
ko: 난 그 가게는 웬만하면 피하려고 노력해.

en: Before Einstein, scientists used to think that space had no end.
ko: 아인슈타인 이전에는 과학자들이 우주는 끝이 없다고 생각했어.

en: I love the outdoors, but I hate bugs.
ko: 야외 활동은 좋은데 벌레는 진짜 싫어.

en: Einstein was a mathematical genius.
Einstein was far in advance of his time.
Einstein loved playing the violin.
ko: 아인슈타인은 바이올린 켜는 걸 정말 좋아했어요.

en: Einstein's theories contributed greatly to modern science.
ko: 아인슈타인의 이론은 현대 과학에 큰 기여를 했어요.

en: Einstein's theory of relativity is Greek to me.
ko: 아인슈타인의 상대성 이론은 저한테는 완전히 외계어 같아요.

en: Such scientists as Einstein are rare.
ko: 아인슈타인 같은 과학자는 정말 보기 드물어요.

en: Theoretical physics was child's play to Einstein, but he couldn't figure out his income tax.
ko: 아인슈타인에게 이론 물리학은 식은 죽 먹기였지만, 소득세 계산은 못 했대요.

en: We associate Einstein with the theory of relativity.
We associate the name of Einstein with the theory of relativity.
ko: 아인슈타인이라는 이름은 상대성 이론과 떼놓을 수 없죠.

en: Einstein has been dead for nearly forty years.
ko: 아인슈타인이 세상을 떠난 지 거의 40년이 됐어요.

en: I'm hopeless at ironing so I buy permanent press clothes.
ko: 다림질을 워낙 못 해서 구김이 잘 안 가는 옷만 사요.

The Irishman replies.

ko: 아이린 페퍼버그는 알렉스라고 이름 지은 앵무새 앞에 둥근 쟁반을 들고 있어요.

en: We should put out a call for bids.
I'm afraid the line is busy.
I'm sorry, my father is out.
I'm sorry my father is out.
I'm afraid we don't have any left.
To my great disappointment, she didn't come.
Unfortunately he refused to come.

en: Unfortunately, the store was closed.
Unfortunately I hit the morning rush hour.
As it happened, my grandmother was not at home.
Unfortunately, there was no one around.
Unfortunately I was not in time for his speech.
As it happens, I have left the camera at home.

ko: 마침 지금 신청서가 제 손에 없네요.

ko: 마침 그날 할머니가 집에 안 계셨어요.

en: Unfortunately, it rained yesterday.
As it happens, I have no money with me now.
Unfortunately, it rained.

ko: 하필이면 그분을 찾아뵙기에 아주 안 좋은 시간이었네요.

en: Sorry, but he is out now.
I'm sorry, today is fully booked.
I'm sorry, but I can't accept your invitation. I have other plans on that day.
ko: 죄송하지만 그날 다른 선약이 있어서 초대를 못 받을 것 같아요.

en: Unfortunately, I missed seeing the movie.
I'm afraid I can't accept your invitation.
ko: 죄송하지만 초대에 응하기 어려울 것 같아요.

en: I regret to say that the product you have asked for is currently out of stock.
As it happens, she is absent.
As it happened, I left my homework at home.
ko: 어쩌다 보니 숙제를 집에 두고 왔어요.

en: I'm sorry, your line is busy.
At the pop star's concert the fans were swarming around the foot of the stage.
ko: 팝스타 콘서트에서 팬들이 무대 앞쪽으로 구름처럼 몰려들었어요.

en: Accepting the other's norms is submitting to the other's power.
ko: 상대방의 규범을 받아들이는 건 그 사람의 힘에 굴복하는 거예요.

en: Ai and Mariko are close friends. They go everywhere together.
ko: 아이와 마리코는 친한 친구예요. 어디든 같이 다녀요.

en: There is no shortage of ideas.
He shot at me.

ko: 걔 너무 몰아붙이지 마. 무슨 짓을 할지 모르잖아. 조심해서 나쁠 거 없지. 궁지에 몰린 쥐가 고양이를 문다는 말도 있잖아.

en: He's a different person when he's drunk, so I don't like to drink with him.
ko: 걔는 술 마시면 딴사람이 돼서 같이 마시기 싫어.

en: He shall die.
I will give him trouble.
ko: 내가 걔 골탕 좀 먹여줄 거야.

en: He gives me chills.
They passed out.

He's not a very meticulous guy.

ko: 내일 무슨 일이 있어도 꼭 복수할 거야.

ko: 걔 늦을 것 같으니까 확실히 하게 7시라고 다시 한번 말해줘.

en: He is a wolf in sheep's clothing.

He is a daredevil.
ko: 걔는 진짜 물불 안 가리는 애야.

en: He's got money to burn.

He is a formidable opponent.
He is a spoiled child.

He is so heartless.
He is a poet or something.
ko: 걔 무슨 시인이라도 된 줄 아나 봐.

en: They say fine words are no virtue if they're insincere and that's him in a nutshell. He's all talk but doesn't mean a word of it.
ko: 말만 번지르르하고 진심 없는 건 딱 걔 얘기야. 입만 살았어.

en: He has a sharp tongue.
He has a smooth tongue.
Don't tell him. He's got a loose tongue.
He is nasty.
He is a tough customer.
He has more lives than a cat.

en: He is a self-willed fellow.
He has an evil countenance.
He should have worked harder.
He is a hard boiled egg.
What an oddball he is!
He is busy loafing on the job.
ko: 걔 일하는 척하면서 농땡이 치느라 바빠.

en: He is no ordinary man.
He is very mercenary.
That fellow is a cool hand.
That man is notorious as a gambler.
He is the dumbest kid in the class.
He's a car nut. Ask him anything.
ko: 걔 완전 차 덕후야. 아무거나 물어봐.

en: That guy is always asking his parents for money.
ko: 걔는 맨날 부모님한테 돈 달라고 해.

Who the devil was that?

ko: 걔 여자들 앞에서는 엄청 잘난 척해.

He is a good joker.

He's a goner.

ko: 걔가 너무 예의 바른 척 가르치려 들던 게 생각만 해도 진짜 재수 없어.

ko: 걔가 얼마나 멍청한지 볼 때마다 기가 막혀.

en: I'll put his courage to the test.
ko: 걔 용기가 어느 정도인지 한번 시험해 볼게.

ko: 내가 걔 손해 본 거 메꿔줘야 돼.

en: I'll kill him.

ko: 걔 잘난 척하며 말하는 거 꼴 보기 싫어.

en: I have had quite enough of his jokes.

ko: 내가 걔한테 매달려 사는 거 아냐.

en: You don't have to listen to what he says.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 들을 필요 없어.

en: Don't take any notice of what he says.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 신경 쓰지 마.

en: Nobody likes him, because he is always blowing his own horn.
ko: 걔는 맨날 지 자랑만 해서 아무도 안 좋아해.

ko: 어떤 일이든 걔한테 믿고 맡겨도 돼.

ko: 걔가 나한테 시비 걸려고 구실을 만들더라.

ko: 걔를 어쩌면 좋을지 모르겠어. 아무리 화를 내도 그냥 한 귀로 듣고 한 귀로 흘려.

ko: 걔 비판하는 사람은 다 제 무덤 파는 거야.

ko: 나 걔랑 다시는 말 안 할 거야!

ko: 맨날 잘난 척 떠들지만 조만간 밑천 다 드러날걸.

en: He lives a freewheeling life. I think he ought to settle down a little.
ko: 걔는 너무 제멋대로 살아. 이제 좀 정착해야 될 텐데.

ko: 걔가 정직하다고 믿는다면 넌 미친 거야. 걔가 뒤에서 무슨 짓 하는지 몰라서 그래.

en: He looks suspicious.

ko: 저렇게 기고만장한 걸 보니 뭔가 대단한 일이라도 있었나 봐.

en: That man is a wet blanket.
He is buttering up to his boss.
Ouch! My foot!
